title: 114_s2888
content: The "Janey Ensminger Act of 2016" is a law that reviews illnesses and conditions of veterans stationed at Camp Lejeune, North Carolina, and their family members. It amends the Public Health Service Act to include a section on the review and publication of illnesses and conditions related to these individuals. The "Janey Ensminger Act of 2016" requires the Secretary to review scientific literature on illnesses related to individuals who lived or worked at Camp Lejeune, North Carolina between 1953 and 1987, due to exposure to toxic substances. The "Janey Ensminger Act of 2016" mandates the Secretary to categorize evidence of the connection between exposure to toxic substances at Camp Lejeune, North Carolina, and illnesses into three levels of causation. This information must be published in the Federal Register and on the Department of Health and Human Services' website. The Department of Health and Human Services' website must list illnesses and conditions with evidence of causal connection, along with bibliographic citations. The list should be updated to include new determinations since the last update. The Department of Veterans Affairs eligibility for health care is amended to include illnesses or conditions linked to exposure to toxic substances at Camp Lejeune, North Carolina. The Department of Veterans Affairs eligibility for health care is expanded to cover illnesses or conditions related to exposure to toxic substances at Camp Lejeune, North Carolina, regardless of the level of evidence connecting the illness to the exposure. The Department of Veterans Affairs expands eligibility for health care to cover illnesses or conditions related to exposure to toxic substances at Camp Lejeune, North Carolina. Family members of individuals receiving care will also be eligible for continued care, and funds will be transferred for program support. The Department of Veterans Affairs will use funds to improve the claims processing system, eligibility system, and web portal for the Camp Lejeune Family Member Program.
